# Push & Pull w/ R and GitHub

The first step in this process is to *make some changes*, which are unstaged changes.

![](images/Screenshot 2024-10-02 111208.png)

When you are done making modifications, you should *add the desired file to the staging area*.

![](images/Screenshot 2024-10-02 111529.png)

Once the changes have been committed, you *commit your changes.*

![](images/Screenshot 2024-10-02 112259.png)

When your changes are committed, you *push your changes* to the Git repository.

![](images/Screenshot 2024-10-02 112351.png)

# GitHub Learning Achievements

-   Learned about how to stage, commit, and push changes in R.

-   Shared my git repository with other collaborators.

-   Learned how to pull changes made by other collaborators.

-   Saved another student's git repository locally, made changes, and pushed to the repo.
